definition:
Let the positive number $p$ be the antiperiod of the real function $f$
and $$f(t) \geqq 0 \quad \mbox{for} \;\; 0 < t < p.$$ Then the function
$f_1$ defined by $$\begin{aligned}
f_1(t) \;:=\; \max\{f(t),\,0\} \;=\;
\begin{cases}
f(t) \quad \mbox{for} \;\; f(t) > 0,\\
0 \qquad\, \mbox{for} \;\; f(t) \leqq 0
\end{cases}\end{aligned}$$ is the *half-wave rectification* of $f$ and
the function $f_2$ defined by $$f_2(t) \;:=\; |f(t)|$$ is the *full-wave
rectification* of $f$. They are , the former with $2p$ and the latter
with $p$.\
The Laplace transforms are
$$\mathcal{L}\{f_1(t)\} \;=\; \frac{1}{1\!-\!e^{-ps}}F(s),$$
$$\mathcal{L}\{f_2(t)\} \;=\; \frac{1\!+\!e^{-ps}}{1\!-\!e^{-ps}}F(s).$$
